Compatibility: Participants may not be able to use the virtual reality gaming systems they own, resulting in incompatibility issues and difficulty in creating levels that work with different devices.
Cheating: Participants may try to cheat or use hacks to gain an advantage in the tournament, requiring the tournament organizers to constantly monitor the games and prevent cheating.
Competition: Participants may become too competitive and start disrespecting other players, which could lead to a lack of sportsmanship and an unpleasant environment.
Time zones: Participants may be located in different time zones, resulting in confusion over scheduling and difficulty in coordinating the tournament.
Funding: The organizers may have difficulty funding the reward pool or other amenities needed to host a successful tournament.
